title: Lowest CO2 Emissions from Fugitive Energy Sources
description: In 2023, Ethiopia recorded one of the lowest CO2 emissions from fugitive energy sources globally, with a value of just 0.0001 Mt CO2e.

title: Minimal Urban Population in Large Cities
description: As of 2024, only 4.32% of Ethiopia's population lived in urban agglomerations of more than 1 million, indicating a predominantly rural demographic.

title: Longest Lead Time to Export
description: In 2018, Ethiopia had one of the longest lead times to export, with a median of 60 days, highlighting logistical challenges in trade.

title: High Investment in Tertiary Education
description: In 2015, Ethiopia allocated 47.85% of its government education expenditure to tertiary education, reflecting a strong commitment to higher education.

title: Low Female Doctoral Attainment
description: By 2021, only 0.006% of Ethiopian females aged 25+ had attained a doctoral or equivalent level of education, indicating gender disparities in higher education.

title: Limited Access to Basic Sanitation
description: In 2022, only 9.34% of Ethiopia's population had access to at least basic sanitation services, highlighting significant public health challenges.

title: Low Male Employment as Employers
description: As of 2023, only 0.15% of employed Ethiopian males were employers, suggesting limited entrepreneurial opportunities.

title: Low Overall Employment as Employers
description: In 2023, just 0.13% of Ethiopia's total employment was comprised of employers, indicating a small entrepreneurial sector.

title: Incomplete Birth Registration
description: In 2016, only 2.7% of births in Ethiopia were registered, pointing to significant gaps in civil registration systems.
